value.name: port
value.description: ONVIF port of the camera.

value.name: username
value.description: ONVIF username for the camera.

value.name: password
value.description: ONVIF password for the camera.

value.name: timeout
value.description: Timeout for ONVIF connections in seconds.

value.name: use_https
value.description: Use HTTPS for ONVIF connections.

value.name: verify_ssl
value.description: Verify SSL certificates for ONVIF connections.

value.name: wsdl_dir
value.description: Path to custom WSDL directory for ONVIF client.

value.name: auto_config
value.description: Set to true then it will ignore all configuration per each service and use the default service that is already on the ONVIF camera. Don't worry! This ONVIF component will automatically detect the existing configuration in the ONVIF camera precisely.

value.name: hostname
value.description: The hostname of the device.

value.name: discoverable
value.description: Whether the device is discoverable on the network via WS-Discovery.

value.name: datetime_type
value.description: Defines if the date and time is set via NTP or manually.

value.name: daylight_savings
value.description: Indicates whether Daylight Savings Time is in effect.

value.name: timezone
value.description: The time zone in POSIX 1003.1 format. Will be ignored if the datetime_type key is set to NTP.

value.name: ntp_from_dhcp
value.description: Indicate if NTP address information is to be retrieved using DHCP.

value.name: ntp_type
value.description: Network host type: IPv4, IPv6 or DNS. Will be ignored if the ntp_from_dhcp key is set to true.

value.name: ntp_server
value.description: The NTP server of the device, for example: pool.ntp.org or time.google.com or 192.168.1.1 (must match with ntp_type). Will be ignored if the ntp_from_dhcp key is set to true.

value.name: device
value.description: Device service configuration.

value.name: encoding
value.description: Used video codec, either Jpeg, H.264 or Mpeg4

value.name: width
value.description: Number of the columns of the Video image. If there is a 90-degree rotation, this represents the number of lines of the Video image.

value.name: height
value.description: Number of the lines of the Video image. If there is a 90-degree rotation, this represents the number of columns of the Video image.

value.name: resolution
value.description: Configured video resolution

value.name: force_persistence
value.description: To determine whether this video encoder setting will persist even after a device reboot.

value.name: mpeg4_profile
value.description: Only valid if encoding key is set to MPEG4. The Mpeg4 profile, either simple profile (SP) or advanced simple profile (ASP)

value.name: h264_profile
value.description: Only valid if encoding key is set to H264. The H.264 profile, either baseline, main, extended or high

value.name: quality
value.description: Relative value for the video quantizers and the quality of the video. A high value within supported quality range means higher quality

value.name: frame_rate
value.description: Maximum output framerate in fps. If an encoding_interval is provided the resulting encoded framerate will be reduced by the given factor.

value.name: encoding_interval
value.description: Interval at which images are encoded and transmitted. (A value of 1 means that every frame is encoded, a value of 2 means that every 2nd frame is encoded ...)

value.name: bitrate_limit
value.description: the maximum output bitrate in kbps

value.name: gov_length
value.description: Determines typically the interval in which the I-Frames will be coded. An entry of 1 indicates I-Frames are continuously generated. An entry of 2 indicates that every 2nd image is an I-Frame, and 3 only every 3rd frame, etc. The frames in between are coded as P or B Frames.

value.name: video_encoder
value.description: Settings applied to your camera's video encoder. These settings will be applied to the media profile that matches the RTSP url you set in the camera domain (ffmpeg or gstreamer).

value.name: encoding
value.description: Audio codec used for encoding the audio input (either G.711, G.726 or AAC)

value.name: force_persistence
value.description: To determine whether this audio encoder setting will persist even after a device reboot.

value.name: bitrate
value.description: The output bitrate in kbps.

value.name: sample_rate
value.description: The output sample rate in kHz.

value.name: audio_encoder
value.description: Settings applied to your camera's audio encoder. These settings will be applied to the media profile that matches the RTSP url you set in the camera domain (ffmpeg or gstreamer).

value.name: media
value.description: Media service configuration.

value.name: force_persistence
value.description: To determine whether this setting will persist even after a device reboot.

value.name: brightness
value.description: Brightness of the image (unit unspecified).

value.name: color_saturation
value.description: Color Saturation of the image (unit unspecified).

value.name: contrast
value.description: Contrast of the image (unit unspecified).

value.name: sharpness
value.description: Sharpness of the Video image (unit unspecified).

value.name: ircut_filter
value.description: Infrared Cutoff Filter settings.

value.name: backlight_compensation
value.description: Enabled/disabled Backlight Compensation mode (on/off).

value.name: exposure
value.description: Exposure mode of the device.

value.name: focus
value.description: Focus configuration.

value.name: wide_dynamic_range
value.description: Wide dynamic range settings.

value.name: white_balance
value.description: White balance settings.

value.name: image_stabilization
value.description: Optional element to configure Image Stabilization feature.

value.name: ircut_filter_auto_adjustment
value.description: An optional parameter applied to only auto mode to adjust timing of toggling Infrared Cutoff filter.

value.name: tone_compensation
value.description: Optional element to configure Image Contrast Compensation.

value.name: defogging
value.description: Optional element to configure Image Defogging.

value.name: noise_reduction
value.description: Optional element to configure Image Noise Reduction.

value.name: imaging
value.description: Imaging service configuration.

value.name: home_position
value.description: Move camera to home position on startup (if supported by camera). Will be ignored if any of the PTZ presets have the on_startup set to true.

value.name: reverse_pan
value.description: Reverse the pan direction. Will be implemented in backend and frontend, and will not affect the position of user defined PTZ presets.

value.name: reverse_tilt
value.description: Reverse the tilt direction. Will be implemented in backend and frontend, and will not affect the position of user defined PTZ presets.

value.name: min_pan
value.description: Minimum pan value of the camera. A value between -1.0 and 1.0 (will be adjusted based on the default ONVIF configuration). Automatically handled by the backend.

value.name: max_pan
value.description: Maximum pan value of the camera. A value between -1.0 and 1.0 (will be adjusted based on the default ONVIF configuration). Automatically handled by the backend.

value.name: min_tilt
value.description: Minimum tilt value of the camera. A value between -1.0 and 1.0 (will be adjusted based on the default ONVIF configuration). Automatically handled by the backend.

value.name: max_tilt
value.description: Maximum tilt value of the camera. A value between -1.0 and 1.0 (will be adjusted based on the default ONVIF configuration). Automatically handled by the backend.

value.name: min_zoom
value.description: Minimum zoom value of the camera. A value between -1.0 and 1.0 (will be adjusted based on the default ONVIF configuration). Automatically handled by the backend.

value.name: max_zoom
value.description: Maximum zoom value of the camera. A value between -1.0 and 1.0 (will be adjusted based on the default ONVIF configuration). Automatically handled by the backend.

values.name: pan
values.description: Pan value of the PTZ preset. A value between -1.0 and 1.0.

values.name: tilt
values.description: Tilt value of the PTZ preset. A value between -1.0 and 1.0.

values.name: zoom
values.description: Zoom value of the PTZ preset. A value between -1.0 and 1.0

values.name: on_startup
values.description: Move to this (named) preset on startup.

value.name: presets
value.description: A list of user-defined PTZ presets (using the Absolute Move operation if supported by camera). These presets will not be saved to the ONVIF camera.

value.name: ptz
value.description: PTZ service configuration.
Camera identifier. Valid characters are lowercase a-z, numbers and underscores.

value.name: cameras
value.description: List of ONVIF cameras to make available to the component.
